reference.title: GIC registers
reference.shortdesc: This chapter describes the GIC registers.

link.linktext: CPU interface registers
link.desc: Each CPU interface block provides the interface for the Cortexâ€‘A76 core that interfaces with a GIC distributor within the system.

link.linktext: AArch64 physical GIC CPU interface system register summary
link.desc: The following table lists the AArch64 physical GIC CPU interface system registers that have IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED bits.

link.linktext: ICC_AP0R0_EL1, Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 0 Register 0, EL1
link.desc: The ICC_AP0R0_EL1 provides information about Group 0 active priorities.

link.linktext: ICC_AP1R0_EL1, Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Register 0 EL1
link.desc: The ICC_AP1R0_EL1 provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

link.linktext: ICC_BPR0_EL1, Interrupt Controller Binary Point Register 0, EL1
link.desc: ICC_BPR0_EL1 defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 0 interrupt preemption.

link.linktext: ICC_BPR1_EL1, Interrupt Controller Binary Point Register 1, EL1
link.desc: ICC_BPR1_EL1 defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 1 interrupt preemption.

link.linktext: ICC_CTLR_EL1, Interrupt Controller Control Register, EL1
link.desc: ICC_CTLR_EL1 controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

link.linktext: ICC_CTLR_EL3, Interrupt Controller Control Register, EL3
link.desc: ICC_CTLR_EL3 controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

link.linktext: ICC_SRE_EL1, Interrupt Controller System Register Enable Register, EL1
link.desc: ICC_SRE_EL1 controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL0 and EL1.

link.linktext: ICC_SRE_EL2, Interrupt Controller System Register Enable register, EL2
link.desc: ICC_SRE_EL2 controls whether the system register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL2.

link.linktext: ICC_SRE_EL3, Interrupt Controller System Register Enable register, EL3
link.desc: ICC_SRE_EL3 controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL3.

link.linktext: AArch64 virtual GIC CPU interface register summary
link.desc: The following table describes the AArch64 virtual GIC CPU interface system registers that have IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED bits.

link.linktext: ICV_AP0R0_EL1, Interrupt Controller Virtual Active Priorities Group 0 Register 0, EL1
link.desc: The ICV_AP0R0_EL1 register provides information about virtual Group 0 active priorities.

link.linktext: ICV_AP1R0_EL1, Interrupt Controller Virtual Active Priorities Group 1 Register 0, EL1
link.desc: The ICV_AP1R0_EL1 register provides information about virtual Group 1 active priorities.

link.linktext: ICV_BPR0_EL1, Interrupt Controller Virtual Binary Point Register 0, EL1
link.desc: ICV_BPR0_EL1 defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines virtual Group 0 interrupt preemption.

link.linktext: ICV_BPR1_EL1, Interrupt Controller Virtual Binary Point Register 1, EL1
link.desc: ICV_BPR1_EL1 defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines virtual Group 1 interrupt preemption.

link.linktext: ICV_CTLR_EL1, Interrupt Controller Virtual Control Register, EL1
link.desc: ICV_CTLR_EL1 controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC virtual CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

link.linktext: AArch64 virtual interface control system register summary
link.desc: The following table lists the AArch64 virtual interface control system registers that have IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED bits.

link.linktext: ICH_AP0R0_EL2, Interrupt Controller Hyp Active Priorities Group 0 Register 0, EL2
link.desc: The ICH_AP0R0_EL2 provides information about Group 0 active priorities for EL2.

link.linktext: ICH_AP1R0_EL2, Interrupt Controller Hyp Active Priorities Group 1 Register 0, EL2
link.desc: The ICH_AP1R0_EL2 provides information about Group 1 active priorities for EL2.

link.linktext: ICH_HCR_EL2, Interrupt Controller Hyp Control Register, EL2
link.desc: ICH_HCR_EL2 controls the environment for VMs.

link.linktext: ICH_VMCR_EL2, Interrupt Controller Virtual Machine Control Register, EL2
link.desc: ICH_VMCR_EL2 enables the hypervisor to save and restore the virtual machine view of the GIC state.

link.linktext: ICH_VTR_EL2, Interrupt Controller VGIC Type Register, EL2
link.desc: ICH_VTR_EL2 reports supported GIC virtualization features.
